summary: Fix skills progress bar animation flicker by eliminating timing conflicts between JavaScript timeout and CSS transitions. The issue occurs because the animateSkillBar function uses a 300ms setTimeout before setting the final width, which conflicts with the 1s CSS transition, causing bars to flicker and move backwards during animation.

action_plan.description: Set initial width to 0% for all skill progress bars before animation starts to ensure consistent starting state
Remove the arbitrary 300ms setTimeout delay in animateSkillBar function to eliminate timing conflicts
Ensure skill progress bars start with width: 0% in CSS to prevent initial flash of content
Update renderSkills function to explicitly set initial width to 0% when creating skill items
Test the animation locally by serving the site and scrolling to skills section to verify smooth animation
Verify animation works correctly across different scroll speeds and multiple skill categories

risks: Animation timing might need fine-tuning for optimal visual effect
Changes could affect other scroll-triggered animations if intersection observer logic is modified
Different browsers might handle CSS transitions slightly differently
dependencies: Local development server for testing (python -m http.server or npx serve)
issue_title: Bug: Skills progress bars flicker and move backwards during animation
